commitResults.messageTitle: Rename main class to Dude
commitResults.messageBody: Implement Level-1

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-2
commitResults.messageBody:
Create Task class

Refactor Dude class so main serves a Dude instance

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-3
commitResults.messageBody: Add error message support

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-4
commitResults.messageBody:
Add error handling for incorrect user inputs (ParsingException)

Add classes Todo, Deadline, Event

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement A-TextUITesting
Implement Level-5
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename ParsingException to MessageInterpretationException

Make parsing more robust to extra whitespace and detecting empty input

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-6
commitResults.messageBody:
Abstract common patterns into generic functions
- addTask abstracts over parser used (Todo::parseTodo etc.)
- taskListOperation abstracts over commands that operate on a single
  index in the task list (done and delete)

Create ThrowingFunction functional interface to allow abstracting
parsing functions (which throw checked exceptions)

Clean up interface of Dude commands - instead of some throwing
exceptions and some handling errors with respondError, now all handle
their own errors so Dude.serve has no error handling

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test case
Create package dude and move all classes to dude package
Implement Level-7
commitResults.messageBody:
Abstract Dude internal task storage to IDudeTaskStore interface

Create DudeTaskStore class to handle file IO and maintain task list
while running

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-8
commitResults.messageBody:
Change date information in Deadline and Event to be proper Date type
LocalDate

Change message parser to only accept /by and /at in format yyyy-mm-dd

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-8
commitResults.messageBody:
Correct Event to include 2 dates (start and end) with a new message
format (event details /from yyyy-mm-dd /to yyyy-mm-dd)

Convert Task into abstract class with abstract method occursOn which
checks if a deadline or event is on a given date, while todos always
return false

Add 2 new commands check yyyy-mm-dd and today. check date shows all
deadlines and events that occur on the given date while today is a
convenience for check (today's date)

Update test case

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract UserInterface into interface separate from Dude
commitResults.messageBody:
Create subpackage dude.component for chatbot related interfaces and
implementing classes UI and TaskStore

commitResults.messageTitle: Separate IDudeTaskStore into TaskList and IStorage
commitResults.messageBody:
Change storage format to simpler (but less safe) format -
"type|isDone|details|(deadline or event dates)"
which can be easily parsed by String.split("\\|") but fails to parse
events with the "|" character

Add storeFormat method to Task classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Command class and move all command execution code into its respective subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
Create CommandExecutionException class for exceptions that occur when
executing tasks (To distinguish parsing errors from commands that are
syntactically correct but invalid (eg. trying to delete task that does
not exist, or mark a task that is already done as done)

Add Parser class which handles parsing work, reducing role of Task
subclasses to dumb constructors while Parser handles parsing messages
to Commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement A-MoreOOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace previous implementations of parsing and command execution
(scattered between Task classes and Dude methods) with Parser class
and Command classes created in previous commit

Move ParsingException to dude.component as it is a unique exception of
the Parser class

Remove ThrowingFunction functional interface which is a relic of
the previous implementation

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement A-Packages (mostly implemented already)
commitResults.messageBody:
Move Task and subclasses into dude.task package so dude.Dude is only
top-level class (i.e. only class in dude package)

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement A-JUnit, create unit tests for Parser class to test behavior on various inputs and simple property testing of TaskList
Modify TextStorage to attempt to create the /data/ directory if it does not exist so it can save /data/dude.txt files and retrieve them no matter where the packaged jar is run from.
Implement A-JavaDoc to comment on all public methods
Edit JavaDoc comments to have more consistent style, proper formatting (such as escaping < and >, and correct formatting for @see tags)
Implement A-CodingStandard
commitResults.messageBody:
Use checkstyle to enforce coding style according to the Google Java
Style Guide, but ignore errors from missing JavaDoc comments since
JavaDoc is added in other branch (branch-A-JavaDoc)

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-9
commitResults.messageBody:
Add FindCommand class, which, on execute, filters and prints all tasks
whose descriptions match the exact string given

Add "find" case to Parser.parse which spawns FindCommand

Add "find" command to Parser.usages

commitResults.messageTitle: Fully Implement A-CodingStandard to abide by JavaDoc standards
commitResults.messageBody: Dude now passes all checkstyle tests

commitResults.messageTitle: Create a working GUI for Duke with stub logic (Duke only replies "hey")
commitResults.messageBody: Rename Main class to Duke as per iP requirements

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level-10 with a fully functioning Duke GUI that responds identically to the TextUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace UI class with GUI class that implements the same IUserInterface
interface so no changes to other classes are needed. GUI class contains
reference to MainWindow controller to call the input/output methods it
exposes

Rename unused UI class to TextUI, soon to be deprecated

Rework Duke#serve from the event loop that blocks on user input to an
event-driven architecture as required by javafx

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Command class so execute no longer takes IStorage, since saving is performed outside ByeCommand to allow saving even when no command is given (like when exiting by closing the window)
commitResults.messageBody:
Miscellaneous updates to JavaDoc and naming standards (renamed GUI to Gui)

Remove TextUI class as it is no longer used

Improve IUserInterface by providing the variant respond methods with
default implementations. This makes it clear that speak and
respond(Runnable r) are the only primitives and the rest are convenience
methods

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Parser to split parse method into smaller methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser.parse now calls Parser.parseSingleWordCommand and
Parser.parseCommandWithArguments, applying them sequentially
and checking if each returned null before trying the next

Update Test for Parser so empty String should result in error
message about incomplete command instead of not understanding the
command

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor all TaskList enumerating methods and calls to consistently use Stream API
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, getAllTasks returned a List<Task> while showAllTasks returned a String[].
Furthermore each calling method implemented their own filtering/formatting and basically
consumed the collection immediately. Using the Stream API, the new formatFilteredTasks
and its derivative showFilteredTasks take care of filtering and formatting, while
returning an unconsumed Stream<String>, bypassing intermediate data structures

Update build to v0.2

Update TaskListTest to reflect changes to TaskList

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor refactor of Parser.parseCommandWithArguments to extract Deadline parsing and Event parsing into their own methods
Fix bug in Parser.parse
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously invalid single word commands or empty strings result in a null usage message
in the error message. Now correct error messages with relevant usage info is given

Improve DialogBox in GUI

Font size increase and change from Label to Text allows DialogBox to expand to show
entire message without truncating text with ellipsis

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Duke class for looser coupling with dependencies
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove implementation-specific details from Duke, key of which were:
- Platform.exit() to exit javafx application
- Concrete classes Gui and TextStorage
Duke now only depends on Interfaces, relegates specifying of dependencies to DukeFactory
which has benefits of easier stubbing for unit testing

Create DukeTest unit testing class to test simple serve() behavior

commitResults.messageTitle: Setup Travis-CI
commitResults.messageBody: Remove configuration files that were accidentally included in the project

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to Gui and Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
Most of the methods already check their assumptions and catch exceptional cases, thus
very few assertions are added

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new command, help, with HelpCommand class
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor parsing error messages

Only 1 usage message is provided. For the unmatched case, user is simply referred to
the help command where all the usage messages are shown

commitResults.messageTitle: Add feature of flexible date formats
commitResults.messageBody:
Since Date parsing is so complex, it is separated into its own DateParser class that
parses 4 different date formats, 2 absolute (yyyy-mm-dd and d MMM yyyy) and 2 relative
to the current date (offset-based, eg. 10 days, 1 week, and day of week-based, eg.
Monday +4 means 4 mondays from now)

Add testing for DateParser

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve UI and coding standards
Add acknowledgements for reused code from tutorials directory
commitResults.messageBody: Modify UI slightly - add title, resize image

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor DateParser into separate Parser classes implementing IDateParser
commitResults.messageBody:
This refactor allows each parser to hold state, which allows format, examples and
explanations to be placed in said classes instead of being hard-coded into HelpCommand

commitResults.messageTitle: Update README and add Ui screenshot
Update README and add some images
Create user guide for Dude
Fix Storage only saving upon exit instead of upon every task list change
